io.atomix.copycat.client

Interface CopycatClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCopycatClient

    public interface CopycatClient
    Provides an interface for submitting commands and Query queries to the Copycat cluster.

    Copycat clients are responsible for connecting to the cluster and submitting commands and queries that operate on the cluster's replicated state machine. Copycat clients interact with one or more nodes in a Copycat cluster through a session. When the client is connected, the client will attempt to one of the known member Address provided to the builder. As long as the client can communicate with at least one correct member of the cluster, it can open a session. Once the client is able to register a Session, it will receive an updated list of members for the entire cluster and thereafter be allowed to communicate with all servers.

    Sessions are created by registering the client through the cluster leader. Clients always connect to a single node in the cluster, and in the event of a node failure or partition, the client will detect the failure and reconnect to a correct server.

    Clients periodically send keep-alive requests to the server to which they're connected. The keep-alive request interval is determined by the cluster's session timeout, and the session timeout is determined by the leader's configuration at the time that the session is registered. This ensures that clients cannot be misconfigured with a keep-alive interval greater than the cluster's session timeout.

    Clients communicate with the distributed state machine by submitting commands and queries to the cluster through the submit(Command) and submit(Query) methods respectively: 

       
   client.submit(new PutCommand("foo", "Hello world!")).thenAccept(result -> {
     System.out.println("Result is " + result);
   });
    All client methods are fully asynchronous and return CompletableFuture. To block until a method is complete, use the CompletableFuture.get() or CompletableFuture.join() methods.

    Sessions

    Sessions work to provide linearizable semantics for client commands. When a command is submitted to the cluster, the command will be forwarded to the leader where it will be logged and replicated. Once the command is stored on a majority of servers, the leader will apply it to its state machine and respond according to the command's Command.consistency(). See the Command.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more info.

    Sessions also allow queries (read-only requests) submitted by the client to optionally be executed on follower nodes. When a query is submitted to the cluster, the query's Query.consistency() will be used to determine how the query is handled. For queries with stronger consistency levels, they will be forwarded to the cluster's leader. For weaker consistency queries, they may be executed on follower nodes according to the consistency level constraints. See the Query.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more info.

    Throughout the lifetime of a client, the client may operate on the cluster via multiple sessions according to the configured RecoveryStrategy. In the event that the client's session expires, the client may reopen a new session and continue to submit operations under the recovered session. The client will always attempt to ensure commands submitted are eventually committed to the cluster even across sessions. If a command is submitted under one session but is not completed before the session is lost and a new session is established, the client will resubmit pending commands from the prior session under the new session. This, though, may break linearizability guarantees since linearizability is only guaranteed within the context if a session.

    Users should watch the client for state changes to determine when linearizability guarantees may be broken. 

       
   client.onStateChange(state -> {
     if (state == CopycatClient.State.SUSPENDED) {

     }
   });
    The most notable client state is the SUSPENDED state. This state indicates that the client cannot communicate with the cluster and consistency guarantees may have been broken. While in this state, the client's session from the perspective of servers may timeout, the Session events sent to the client by the cluster may be lost.

    Serialization

    All commands, queries, and session events must be serializable by the Serializer associated with the client. Serializable types can be registered at any time. To register a serializable type and serializer, use the register methods. 
       
   client.serializer().register(SetCommand.class, new SetCommandSerializer());
    By default, all primitives and many collections are supported. Catalyst also provides support for common serialization frameworks like Kryo and Jackson: 
       
   client.serializer().register(SetCommand.class, new GenericKryoSerializer());
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        static CopycatClient.Builder builder(Address... members)
        Returns a new Copycat client builder.

        The provided set of members will be used to connect to the Copycat cluster. The members list does not have to represent the complete list of servers in the cluster, but it must have at least one reachable member that can communicate with the cluster's leader.

        Parameters:
        members - The cluster members to which to connect.
        Returns:
        The client builder.

      • builder

        static CopycatClient.Builder builder(Collection<Address> members)
        Returns a new Copycat client builder.

        The provided set of members will be used to connect to the Copycat cluster. The members list does not have to represent the complete list of servers in the cluster, but it must have at least one reachable member that can communicate with the cluster's leader.

        Parameters:
        members - The cluster members to which to connect.
        Returns:
        The client builder.

      • state

        CopycatClient.State state()
        Returns the current client state.

        The client's CopycatClient.State is indicative of the client's ability to communicate with the cluster at any given time. Users of the client should use the state to determine when guarantees may be lost. See the CopycatClient.State documentation for information on the specific states.

        Returns:
        The current client state.

      • onStateChange

        Listener<CopycatClient.State> onStateChange(Consumer<CopycatClient.State> callback)
        Registers a callback to be called when the client's state changes.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when the client's state changes.
        Returns:
        The client state change listener.

      • context

        ThreadContext context()
        Returns the client execution context.

        The thread context is the event loop that this client uses to communicate with Copycat servers. Implementations must guarantee that all asynchronous CompletableFuture callbacks are executed on a single thread via the returned ThreadContext.

        The ThreadContext can also be used to access the Copycat client's internal serializer via ThreadContext.serializer().

        Returns:
        The client thread context.

      • transport

        Transport transport()
        Returns the client transport.

        The transport is the mechanism through which the client communicates with the cluster. The transport cannot be used to access client internals, but it serves only as a mechanism for providing users with the same transport/protocol used by the client.

        Returns:
        The client transport.

      • serializer

        Serializer serializer()
        Returns the client serializer.

        The serializer can be used to manually register serializable types for submitted commands and queries. 

           
     client.serializer().register(MyObject.class, 1);
     client.serializer().register(MyOtherObject.class, new MyOtherObjectSerializer(), 2);
        Returns:
        The client operation serializer.

      • session

        Session session()
        Returns the client session.

        The returned Session instance will remain constant as long as the client maintains its session with the cluster. Maintaining the client's session requires that the client be able to communicate with one server that can communicate with the leader at any given time. During periods where the cluster is electing a new leader, the client's session will not timeout but will resume once a new leader is elected.

        Returns:
        The client session or null if no session is open.

      • submit

        default <T> CompletableFuture<T> submit(Operation<T> operation)
        Submits an operation to the Copycat cluster.

        This method is provided for convenience. The submitted Operation must be an instance of Command or Query.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The operation result type.
        Parameters:
        operation - The operation to submit.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the operation result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the Operation is not an instance of Command or Query.
        NullPointerException - if operation is null

      • submit

        <T> CompletableFuture<T> submit(Command<T> command)
        Submits a command to the Copycat cluster.

        Commands are used to alter state machine state. All commands will be forwarded to the current cluster leader. Once a leader receives the command, it will write the command to its internal Log and replicate it to a majority of the cluster. Once the command has been replicated to a majority of the cluster, it will apply the command to its StateMachine and respond with the result.

        Once the command has been applied to a server state machine, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed with the state machine output.

        Note that all client submissions are guaranteed to be completed in the same order in which they were sent (program order) and on the same thread. This does not, however, mean that they'll be applied to the server-side replicated state machine in that order. State machine order is dependent on the configured Command.ConsistencyLevel.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The command result type.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to submit.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the command result. The future is guaranteed to be completed after all Command or Query submission futures that preceded it. The future will always be completed on the
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if command is null

      • submit

        <T> CompletableFuture<T> submit(Query<T> query)
        Submits a query to the Copycat cluster.

        Queries are used to read state machine state. The behavior of query submissions is primarily dependent on the query's Query.ConsistencyLevel. For Query.ConsistencyLevel#LINEARIZABLE and Query.ConsistencyLevel#BOUNDED_LINEARIZABLE consistency levels, queries will be forwarded to the cluster leader. For lower consistency levels, queries are allowed to read from followers. All queries are executed by applying queries to an internal server state machine.

        Once the query has been applied to a server state machine, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed with the state machine output.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The query result type.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to submit.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the query result. The future is guaranteed to be completed after all Command or Query submission futures that preceded it. The future will always be completed on the
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if query is null

      • onEvent

        Listener<Void> onEvent(String event,
                       Runnable callback)
        Registers a void event listener.

        The registered Runnable will be called when an event is received from the Raft cluster for the client. CopycatClient implementations must guarantee that consumers are always called in the same thread for the session. Therefore, no two events will be received concurrently by the session. Additionally, events are guaranteed to be received in the order in which they were sent by the state machine.

        Parameters:
        event - The event to which to listen.
        callback - The session receive callback.
        Returns:
        The listener context.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if event or callback is null

      • onEvent

        <T> Listener<T> onEvent(String event,
                        Consumer<T> callback)
        Registers an event listener.

        The registered Consumer will be called when an event is received from the Raft cluster for the session. CopycatClient implementations must guarantee that consumers are always called in the same thread for the session. Therefore, no two events will be received concurrently by the session. Additionally, events are guaranteed to be received in the order in which they were sent by the state machine.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The session event type.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to which to listen.
        callback - The session receive callback.
        Returns:
        The listener context.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if event or callback is null

      • connect

        CompletableFuture<CopycatClient> connect()
        Connects the client to the Copycat cluster.

        When the client is opened, it will attempt to connect to and register a session with each unique configured server Address. Once the session is open, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.CONNECTED state and the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        The client will connect to servers in the cluster according to the pattern specified by theconfigured ServerSelectionStrategy.

        In the event that the client is unable to register a session through any of the servers listed in the provided Address list, the client will use the configured ConnectionStrategy to determine whether and when to retry the registration attempt.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client's session() is open.

      • recover

        CompletableFuture<CopycatClient> recover()
        Recovers the client session.

        When a client is recovered, the client will create and register a new Session. Once the session is recovered, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.CONNECTED state and resubmit pending operations from the previous session. Pending operations are guaranteed to be submitted to the new session in the same order in which they were submitted to the prior session and prior to submitting any new operations.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client's session is recovered.

      • close

        CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Closes the client.

        Closing the client will cause the client to unregister its current Session if open. Once the client's session is unregistered, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed. If the client is unable to unregister its session, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.SUSPENDED state and continue to attempt to reconnect and unregister its session until it is able to unregister its session or determine that it was already expired by the cluster.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client has been closed.
